description: super- +‎ perfect, coined by Suryanarayana in 1969.

entries.meaning:
(mathematics) Being or relating to a class of positive integers satisfying 
  
    
      
        
          σ
          
            2
          
        
        (
        n
        )
        =
        σ
        (
        σ
        (
        n
        )
        )
        =
        2
        n
        
        ,
      
    
    {\displaystyle \sigma ^{2}(n)=\sigma (\sigma (n))=2n\,,}
  
 where σ is the divisor function. They are a generalization of perfect numbers.
